intro: Astroloba robusta, commonly known as the star-shaped bulbous plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features a compact, bulbous base with fleshy, grass-like leaves that are typically green or bluish-gray in color. Its flowers are small, star-shaped, and usually white or pale blue, emerging from the base of the leaves. Astroloba robusta is a hardy, drought-tolerant plant that is well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
